channel.title: Divinity - 2006 Runescape Emulator
channel.description:
[center][size=6]Divinity [/size][/center] [center][i]True [b]2006[/b] Runescape Emulation[/i][/center]
Welcome to the Divinity Project Thread. Divinity's goal is to emulate 2006(317) Runescape as much as possible, by having great stability, Perfect Skills, Minigames, Quests, and just anything that can help make you feel like you are in Runescape of 2006.
Divinity will only be playable threw our Webclient. Anyone attempting to play from another client, or a outdated client will have to face the consequences.
Divinity utilizes my scripting language - Songscript - making the server easier to program.
Divinity will be diffrent from many servers in many ways:
1) No "Noobiness" I really cant stand servers that don't have the decinciy to present themselves in a professional manner. Divinity will be presented to the Players as best as i can.
2) Economy Just like Runescape, you will work for what you want.
3) Professional Staff Staff will always be as good as they can. Staff are the "Ambassadors" For me, and represent me in game.
[b]Diffrences from RS in 2006[/b] 1. A bit easier to get Items + XP(Not alot boys and girls) 2. All of wild is Multi 3. Others (Ill post later) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [center][size=5][b]Goals[/b][/size][/center]
At least 20 Real RS Quests(Not replacing text, instead, using frame36.
Alot of RS Minigames(Castle Wars, Jad, Ect).
All 2006 Skills (Melee - Slayer)
And more
[code]Update Log
1. Perfect Client PM - Set with Node ids 2. All protect from prayers work on NPC's as they should. 3. Webclient system made. 4. Started on an Update Server to update the cache with ease. 5. All Headicons/Hints loaded properly 6. Duel/Multi icon loaded, placed into areas properly, do not interfer with eachother. 7. Weight System Complete - All items weights are in the server cache. 8. Intergrated a scripting language into it, all scripts also in the server cache.[/code] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [center][size=5][b]And Finally - Pictures[/b][/size][/center]
Headicons - This is a old picture. Thanks Blurr for the Tutorial.
[img]http://img262.imageshack.us/img262/9310/headiconsop7.png[/img]
[img]http://img383.imageshack.us/img383/82/wildyky6.png[/img]
And duel arena.
[img]http://img60.imageshack.us/img60/6787/duelnu5.png[/img]
[center][size=6] [b] VIDEOS[/b] [/size][/center]
Weight System. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_OLuVmfCF3g
[size=6][b]Ill update this thread better later[/b] [/size]

item.title: Divinity - 2006 Runescape Emulator
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:41, topic:236795”][quote author=Gnarly… link=topic=312579.msg2498554#msg2498554 date=1224533019]
@ry60003333
You pretty much listed everything shared rev has. >.>
[/quote]
Then compare it to this.
http://www.worldscapeblitz.com/java/508javadoc/
And the APIs I wrote, which I use in it:
http://www.worldscapeblitz.com/java/agfjavadoc/

Plus, I don’t think it uses a scripting language with Java syntax, a Login Server, and a MySQL database. Absolutely no text files, which allows for easily updatable and manageable Worlds.[/quote]

Im placing a scripting language into it for events. I will be making it save to a SQL Database later as well. Loggin server, Graham is doing that next version(s)

Also, the client class is 17 kb big. Everything is handled properly, and interfaces are used for Commands and Packets.

If you guy’s hate winterLove so much, then why dont you release a good source that has features that winterLove has. Because you cant expect everyone to “Stop using wL” Because Y released a good framework. Fact is, everyone is never going to stop using winterLove. The only chance we have is improving it.

I would appreciate it if you guys would stop now. You made your point that winterLove is not good, this point has been made amany times before.

Read full topic

item.title: Divinity - 2006 Runescape Emulator
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Gnarly...:

Yz, if you call the Garbage Collector after a socket is destroyed it will clean up any RAM it used while being on the server. How can that be bad? I totally understand and agree why it’s bad to call it every 500ms or on a timer, because it’s useless.

Because Sun designed the garbage collector to run in the background and to not interfere with your program, and recommend that you don’t try to manually invoke it. Plus there shouldn’t be a need to call it after a disconnection, or your ‘client’ class is too big. Your ‘client’ class probably won’t be the most lightweight class in the server, but it should contain only client specific things. Then for client ‘actions’, you pass a client object to another class which ‘acts’ on that specific client. You would only need once instance of the action object for the entire server.

Also, I bet that the combat code IS located in the client class, which it shouldn’t be, AND I bet that you have to write different code for PvP, PvN (Player vs Npc), and NvN (Npc vs Npc). Java interfaces are your friends, use them. Players and Npcs share common characteristics, so make an Entity class like the client has. There both Attackable, so make an Attackable interface. These kind of ‘innovations’ are what make a server good. These are normal practices to good Java programmers (not ‘coders’), but to this community they will seem like something brand new. Its AMAZING how EASY servers are to program once you have a rock solid foundation to build on.

Everything in technology is layered. From the protocols that run the Internet, too how the Java Virtual Machine wraps around the native OS on your computer. You should be able to modify the lowest level framework of your server without having to touch the actual ‘working’ code. Just like if Sun updated the java.io.Socket object, you wouldn’t notice. You should do something like this. Right now, no released ‘source’ besides RS2Dv would even qualify as good.

Need we say more?

Read full topic

item.title: Divinity - 2006 Runescape Emulator
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Gnarly…, post:34, topic:236795”]@Yz85Racer
Shared Revolutions is the superior base.
It uses hashmaps for packet processing, and command managing. Doing it this way rather than a switch statement for pacekts and if statements for commands is much more effecient and reliable.
The initial buffer auto resizes to its needs.
All input and output is done through the NIO API, Making the server faster and more powerful.
The system garbage collecter is used when there is a downing (When i player gets disconnected)
The servers main processer is done on its own thread via eventmanager.
Removing the loop inside loop processer that is in basic winterlove servers. Doing this is fixing the process and making it more stable, fast, and powerful 500ms processing.
Removed thread-per-client, so your not raping the hell out of your CPU.
The npc vs. player combat is state of the art, with no known bugs.
Greater peformance using NIO.
And if you serious don’t know what NIO is, its New I/O

Need I go on?[/quote]
I’m not an idiot, I do know what NIO is, and don’t try to teach me like I am one. A server base can have no bugs at all, can be perfect to play on - but what does it mean when the base itself is poorly designed? wL tried that, look what happened to the modern era of RuneScape emulation. I take it by “the System garbage collector is run” you mean you invoke System.gc()? Haha, don’t touch that method, if you find you have to manually invoke the Java Garbage Collector, you’re doing something wrong within your design code.

Read full topic

Shared Revolutions is the superior base.
It uses hashmaps for packet processing, and command managing. Doing it this way rather than a switch statement for pacekts and if statements for commands is much more effecient and reliable.
The initial buffer auto resizes to its needs.
All input and output is done through the NIO API, Making the server faster and more powerful.
The system garbage collecter is used when there is a downing (When i player gets disconnected)
The servers main processer is done on its own thread via eventmanager.
Removing the loop inside loop processer that is in basic winterlove servers. Doing this is fixing the process and making it more stable, fast, and powerful 500ms processing.
Removed thread-per-client, so your not raping the hell out of your CPU.
The npc vs. player combat is state of the art, with no known bugs.
Greater peformance using NIO.
And if you serious don’t know what NIO is, its New I/O

Need I go on?
